message: Starting schema analysis - examining current create_real_task implementation and registry structure
Analyzed current implementation. Found: registry stores task_description only, no structured context. Agents receive raw prompt strings. Now designing enhanced schema with 6 new fields.
Designing complete enhanced schema with Python type definitions, validation rules, and storage structure. Creating comprehensive design document.
Schema design complete. Creating validation implementation code and example usage patterns. Coordinating with registry_analyzer findings on injection points.
All deliverables complete. Creating final summary and performing self-review before marking complete.

Schema architecture complete. Delivered 4 comprehensive files totaling 2000+ lines: ENHANCED_TASK_SCHEMA_DESIGN.md (800+ lines, 13 sections with complete schema spec), validation_implementation.py (450+ lines, production-ready code with TaskValidationError/Warning classes, validate_task_parameters(), build_agent_context_section()), INTEGRATION_GUIDE.md (6-step integration guide with line numbers), SCHEMA_DELIVERABLES_SUMMARY.md (executive summary). All success criteria met: 6 new optional parameters designed, registry storage structure defined, comprehensive validation rules documented, backward compatibility guaranteed, implementation-ready with zero ambiguity. Files verified in output/ directory. Other agents (validation_builder, context_injection_builder) have begun implementation using this schema.
